aaron-bauman.name: Aaron Bauman
aaron-bauman.bio: Aaron understands that the state can only grow and profit with smart investment. This means making Nogales the port of choice for produce importers; training a skilled workforce that attracts new business; and preserving the quality of life that drew us to Arizona and keeps us here. As a law student who fought for education reform, government transparency, and the rights of immigrant workers, Aaron knows that we need laws that reflect our values.

adrian-fontes.name: Adrian Fontes
adrian-fontes.bio:
Adrian Fontes is an Arizona Native, former U.S. Marine, small business owner and attorney with more than ten years experience in criminal prosecution, law enforcement and issues of Constitutional Rights.

His trial experience ranges from simple misdemeanor in Municipal Courts in Denver, Colorado, to Murder and Hostage-Taking cases in the Federal District Court in Arizona. Adrian has successfully argued cases before Courts as varied as the South Phoenix Justice Court and up to the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco, California.

martin-quezeda.name: Martin Quezeda

choi-willis.name: Ben Choi & Melvin Willis
choi-willis.bio: Ben Choi, 43, is an account manager at MCE Clean Energy. Choi has served on the Richmond Planning Commission for five years. He pledges to lead Richmond beyond the “two dimensional thinking” of “either clean air or jobs” or “either civil liberties or public safety.” "I grew up in a working-class area of Los Angeles where I helped my immigrant parents run a corner store. We served all the people of our neighborhood -- rich and poor and in between.  But as the sole Korean-American family in a predominantly Latino and Anglo neighborhood, there was no question of trying to blend in. Instead, I came to truly value diversity -- of race, of economics, and of voice, and I had a chance to hear about life from many different perspectives.

manuel-natal.name: Manuel Natal
manuel-natal.bio: Born in 1986, attended Cornell Univ where "he was noted for his leadership and social commitment, serving as president of the Puerto Rican Association of Cornell University." History of student activism. "In 2011,became a legislative advisor to current Majority Spokesman, Carlos "Charlie" Hernandez. In 2013, the representative and chairman of the Judiciary Committee, Luis Vega Ramos, appointed him as CEO of this important legislative committee. During these years, Natal Albelo chaired the Delegation of San Juan of the Bar Association and Lawyers of Puerto Rico and actively participated in the Commission of Lawyers and Young Lawyers of that institution. Elected as At-Large Rep in 2014 and won with 54% of the vote. Has authored about 95 legislative measures with a focus on promoting opportunities for youth, developing local entrepreneurship, PR's fiscal issues, and creating new economic opportunities for PR. Proposed restructuring of PR debt.

carol-ammons.name: Carol Ammons
carol-ammons.bio: Carol Ammons is serving her first term as the full-time state representative of the 103rd District, which includes Champaign-Urbana. Ammons looks to bring her experiences as a grassroots community organizer for equality in education, media and technology access and civil rights to her work as a public servant in the House of Representatives.

clara-hart.name: Clara Hart
clara-hart.bio: Clara Hart is a Mozambique-born South Dakotan running for the District 6 seat in the South Dakota House of Representatives. Clara pledges to serve her community and help build an even stronger South Dakota for all families. As your state representative, she will always work hard to make sure all of our voices are heard in Pierre.

marcy-kaptur.name: Marcy Kaptur
marcy-kaptur.bio: Congresswoman Marcy Kaptur, who represents Ohio's Ninth Congressional District, is currently serving her sixteenth term in the U.S. House of Representatives. She is the senior-most woman in the House and the longest-serving woman from Ohio in history. Congresswoman Kaptur ranks among the most senior Members of the 114th Congress.

ed-cullinane.name: Ed Cullinane
ed-cullinane.bio: Corruption will not fly with Ed! We teach our children from an early age that crime does not pay. When Lobbyists buy Legislators dinner, and the President of the Senate works for a large oil company, then it’s time to reexamine our choices.

david-zuckerman.name: David Zuckerman
david-zuckerman.bio: Dave is entering his fourth year in the Vermont Senate. He is the Vice-Chair of the Senate Committee on Agriculture and the Clerk of the Senate Committee on Education. Previously, Dave represented the City of Burlington for fourteen years in the Vermont House of Representatives, and served on the Natural Resources and Energy Committee, was chairman of the Agriculture Committee, served on the Ways and Means Committee as well. Dave’s leadership spans a number of issues including renewable energy, affordable housing, livable wages, cannabis reform, GMO legislation, universal healthcare, progressive taxation, marriage equality, and end of life choices.

zephyr-teachout.name: Zephyr Teachout
zephyr-teachout.bio: For her entire career Zephyr has been fighting for people who have been shut out– and gotten results. She was the first National Director of the Sunlight Foundation, a non-partisan organization that works to make Congress more open and transparent. After the crash of 2008, she helped start an organization to break up big banks who had become “too big to fail” and have damaged our small businesses.

luis-ramos.name: Luis Vega Ramos
luis-ramos.bio: He was sworn in to the post of Representative at Large, in September 2006. Currently, Vega Ramos chairs the Judiciary Committee and co-chairs the Joint Review to the Criminal Code and the Civil Code Commissions. He is also a member of the Joint Committee on Status Affairs, Commission of Public Security, Development Initiatives Against Crime and Corruption, Government Commission for the Development of the Metropolitan Region, Committee on Agriculture, Committee on Natural Resources and Environmental Affairs, Social Welfare Committee for the Eradication of Poverty, Public Safety Commission, Health Commission, Education Commission for the Promotion of Arts and Culture.

greg-jones.name: Greg Jones
greg-jones.bio: I am passionate about building a brighter future for the communities of Knik-Fairview, Big Lake, Meadow Lakes, and Point Mackenzie. I will work hard to strengthen Alaska's economy and improve the lives of my constituents. As your representative, I will listen to your concerns and make sure your voices are heard in Juneau.

tim-ashe.name: Tim Ashe
tim-ashe.bio: In July 2004, Tim Ashe successfully sought a seat on the Burlington City Council. He won re-election in 2005 and 2007. The youngest member of the Council when elected, Tim quickly established himself as a stalwart supporter of policies to improve and increase the supply of affordable homeownership and rental housing in Burlington. In four years, he was pro-active in nearly every key municipal area. In 2008, Tim was elected to the Vermont State Senate and re-elected in 2010, 2012, and 2014.  Now in his fourth term, Tim has sponsored bills and been a leader on issues ranging from Marriage Equality, to health care reform, to protecting middle-class taxpayers.

jane-kim.name: Jane Kim
jane-kim.bio: Jane Kim is a current San Francisco Supervisor and candidate for State Senate, District 11. Jane is a proven progressive leader who has fought to expand access to affordable housing, protect renters, close the income gap and improve public schools.

juan-mendez.name: Juan Mendez
juan-mendez.bio: Juan ran for office to represent the voice of the working class. He brings to the legislature an understanding of the value of public education and the passion of a citizen who is invested in his community. His legislative priorities include bringing sanity and purpose back to the state budget, by recognizing that private success is dependent on public investment. Juan also aims to restart the American dream of upward mobility for everyone, regardless of privilege, by restoring compassion to our health care system and through strengthening our public schools and universities.

justin-bamberg.name: Justin Bamberg
justin-bamberg.bio: Justin Bamberg is a US Attorney and a Representative for South Carolina's 59th district. He has devoted much of his career to fighting for more fair wages for teachers, expanded healthcare coverage for the middle class, and reforming South Carolina's criminal justice system.

keith-ellison.name: Keith Ellison
keith-ellison.bio: Keith Ellison has represented the Fifth Congressional District of Minnesota in the U.S. House of Representatives since 2007. Keith Ellison's philosophy is one of "generosity and inclusiveness." His roots as a community activist and his message of inclusivity through democratic participation resonates throughout the Fifth District. His priorities in Congress are: promoting peace, prosperity for working families, environmental sustainability, and civil and human rights.

mari-cordes.name: Mari Cordes
mari-cordes.bio: Mari Cordes has been motivated all her life to address the injustices in her community, workplace, and at the state and national level. Over the past several years, Mari has helped draft and move state legislation and policy that have helped many Vermonters. She will represent Lincoln, Starksboro, Monkton and Bristol, and will work to build a brighter future for everyone, not just a few.

paul-clements.name: Paul Clements
paul-clements.bio: Paul Clements understands that our economy must work in a way that benefits all Americans.  It doesn’t have to benefit poor and working class Americans at the expense of the wealthy, but it can no longer afford to benefit wealthy Americans at the expense of the poor and middle class.   As Professor of Political Science at Western Michigan University, Paul teaches national economic and social development strategies dealing with ways government can best promote economic growth and create fair and effective programs.

raul-grijalva.name: Raul Grijalva
raul-grijalva.bio: Raúl has a thirty-year record of exceptional public service in Southern Arizona, and a lifelong commitment to improving the quality of life in his community. Since his election to Congress in 2002, Raúl remains committed to bring fairness and accountability to our federal government in providing services and protecting the health and safety of the public. Education, job creation, employee rights and the environment are some of his top policy concerns.

joseph-salazar.name: Joseph Salazar
joseph-salazar.bio: Rep. Salazar has spent his entire career making sure the rights of hard-working Coloradans are protected, and has brought that same focus to the legislature. Rep. Salazar is a Colorado native whose Spanish and indigenous roots in Colorado and New Mexico go back hundreds of years. He was a civil rights and criminal investigator for the State of Colorado, working for the Colorado Department of Regulatory Agencies in the civil rights division and division of insurance.

rick-nolan.name: Rick Nolan
rick-nolan.bio: Rick is a father and grandfather, married to Mary Nolan for 30 years, and born and raised on the Cuyuna Iron Range in Minnesota’s 8th District. He is successful small-business owner who created jobs throughout northern Minnesota from the sawmill and pallet factory he owned in Emily. Rick has a long history of fighting to defend the middle class, protect social security, and expand medicare.

robyn-porter.name: Robyn Porter
robyn-porter.bio:
Robyn is a dedicated community activist and single mother of two adult children. Her son, who was once incarcerated, has since established his own business. Her daughter is a graduate of the University of Bridgeport and was on the President’s List. Robyn holds an Associate's degree in General Studies from Gateway Community College and a Bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice from Charter Oak State College.

In addition, she completed the Bill Graustein Memorial Fund's Community Leadership Program (CLP), served as co-chair on the Steering Committee for the Newhallville Community Resilience Team, and served as a Ward Committee member where she worked closely with her Alderman on various issues and community events. She has also contributed her time to Aldermanic, Mayoral, and Senatorial campaigns in various capacities.

russ-feingold.name: Russ Feingold
russ-feingold.bio:
Russ Feingold is known for his independence, his honesty and his work ethic on behalf of Wisconsin families. He has always stood up for the middle class families, students and workers who need economic opportunity, often drawing the ire of wealthy special interests and lobbyists.

A lifetime Wisconsin resident, Feingold represented Wisconsin in the U.S. Senate from 1993 to 2011, earning a reputation for doing what’s right, not what’s politically convenient. Whether it was opposing the war in Iraq, co-sponsoring the McCain-Feingold campaign finance law, serving as an early voice for fiscal responsibility, or being the only Senator to oppose the Patriot Act, Feingold has shown that you can make a difference if you’re willing to speak truth to power.

dwight-bullard.name: Dwight Bullard
dwight-bullard.bio: Senator Bullard has served as a leader in the area of Education due to his outstanding leadership and commitment to education, both as a teacher and a policy maker. His extensive and remarkable role in Educational leadership has granted him tremendous recognition; Bullard was a recipient of the Florida Education Association’s Freshman Friend of Public Education Award, and the Florida Association of School Administrators’ Next Generation Leader Award. Senator Bullard is also affiliated with several Democratic organizations, and hence was awarded theYoung Democrat’s of Miami Dade Outstanding Leadership Award. The Redlands Democrat, and currently chairs the Miami-Dade Democratic Party. Dwight is also a member of several community, civic and social organizations ranging from the NAACP to 100 Black Men of South Florida. Senator Bullard is a member of several boards including City Year Miami, Camillus House and the Zoological Society of South Florida and has received countless community recognitions from both local and national groups.

carmen-cruz.name: Carmen Yulin Cruz
carmen-cruz.bio: Served as the president of the Women of the PPD Party since 2003, as a member of the Board of Governors and Alternate PPD spokeswoman in the House of Representatives.

tim-canova.name: Tim Canova
tim-canova.bio: Tim Canova has been challenging Wall Street banks and political corruption for most of his adult life. As an activist, attorney, educator, and frequent commentator on the rigged economic and political systems that put Wall Street and multinational corporations first while leaving ordinary Americans behind, Tim is uniquely positioned to shake up Congress.

tulsi-gabbard.name: Tulsi Gabbard
tulsi-gabbard.bio: Tulsi, by nature, is a public servant who possesses the humility to listen respectfully to all sides of a debate, the experience to handle any challenge, and the courage to make the right decision and get the job done. Tulsi embodies the aloha spirit unique to the island state of Hawai`i. As a mixed race woman, combat veteran, martial artist, lifelong vegetarian, and practicing Hindu, she also is the embodiment of the type of diversity which is at the very heart of what America was founded upon.
